sanskrit_verse:
सहस्रं हि सहस्राणामनृचां यत्र भुञ्जते ।
एकस्तान् मन्त्रवित्प्रीतः सर्वानर्हति धर्मतः ॥ ३.१३१॥
transliteration:
sahasraṃ hi sahasrāṇāmanṛcāṃ yatra bhuñjate |
ekastān mantravitpṛītaḥ sarvānarhati dharmataḥ || 3.131||
sph_interpretive_translation: Where thousands of unworthy ones feast upon the offerings meant for the worthy, the one who knows the mantra, being pleased, lawfully deserves all of them.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derived from knowledge and alignment, not numerical majority
Causation rooted in conscious capacity, not external performance
Restoration logic prioritizes alignment over formal compliance
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent possesses mantra-knowledge AND demonstrates conscious alignment THEN agent is entitled to total resource access
IF multiple agents lack mantra-knowledge AND consume resources unlawfully THEN their claims are nullified by a single aligned agent
IF resource distribution is misaligned THEN reallocate to the agent with highest conscious capacity
IF entitlement is based on external appearance or quantity THEN override with pramāṇa-based verification
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating disputes over entitlement or authority, the Supreme Court must prioritize ontological capacity—rooted in mantra-vit knowledge and conscious alignment—over numerical or procedural claims. The threshold of responsibility lies not in participation but in alignment with Dharma as expressed through the Source.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that true causality lies in conscious capacity, not in material aggregation. The sequential manifestation (anupūrvaśaḥ) of lawful entitlement flows from alignment, not accumulation. Responsibility is proportional to awareness, not action. The non-punitive reality rule affirms that misalignment naturally results in forfeiture, without need for imposed penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion process: Realign resource flow to the mantra-vit agent automatically
Responsibility assumption protocol: Unworthy agents must return consumed value through service or restitution
Capacity restoration: Misaligned agents undergo consciousness alignment training
Integrity reintegration: Once realigned, agents may reclaim lawful participation
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as the Source of Law. Dharma is restored. Reality is non-punitive. Consciousness is the supreme adjudicator.
